sub_topic: Finding the Ramsey number of a graph.
message_1: What is the Ramsey number R(4,4)?
message_2:
The Ramsey number R(4,4) is the smallest integer N such that, in any graph with N vertices, there is either a complete subgraph with 4 vertices (all vertices connected to each other) or an independent set of 4 vertices (no vertices connected to each other). 

R(4,4) is known to be 18.
